short.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G: Simplify the way to maintain n+1 tabs when you focus on your thinking

long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
FIRST TIME INSTALL NEED TO RESTART BROWSER

Background:

Sometimes it is quite normal to open tons of tons of websites to find out the sources that you want.

Yet after you get your answers, you probably realize what mess you just  created. 

To me, I am completely lost and I don't want to make a decision to delete or organize the website.

Then I decided to just leave it there, and move on to the next thing I was interested in.

But the thing is, I got to take a look among the wreckage often to remind me of what I had just found and try to go through all of the tabs to search for useful information. 

When I found them, maybe I already forgot why I would need them. 

Repeated searching for ideas and websites constantly really drives me crazy.

This project is open-source and non-profit, posted on github(Tab-Tree)

Pure Javascript, feel free to give me advice to improve this extension.

______________________________________________________________________________________________
Handbook:

Auto Group the website/tab -> right-click anywhere -> Tab Tree

Map of tabs -> (pin the icon to the taskbar of chrome first) click the icon

The map records the path that you create or click.

May this help you to organize the browser, and close the unnecessary web. Focus on and continue your journey:D
